result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Schmeling was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas J Schmeling is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas J Schmeling was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and DNA surcharge are to be paid at $50 per month commencing 08-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid or serve 15 days jail w/huber, consecutive.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 07:00 p.m. on 05-16-2016.
Apply 1 day sentence credit.

judgments.dispoDesc: State moves to dismiss without prejudice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas J Schmeling

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Exhibits:  1 - 4 from Jury Trial Held on 04/19/16 - Destroyed pursuant to statute.
At the request of the Jail Administrator, the defendant's Huber privileges are revoked fo the balance of his sentence.
From DOC dated 5/26/16 requesting Huber privileges be revoked.
Character Letter, received and filed in court by Atty. Borda.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicholas J Schmeling in court with attorney Eduardo Maximo Borda.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
45 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
1 Day Credit.
Defendant to report to the huber facility by 7 pm on:  05/16/16.

Fine:  $568
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 08/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  15 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Consecutive.
Sentencing hearing on May 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Exhibits:  1 - 4 from Jury Trial Held on 04/19/16 - Scanned.
Per Judge Dreyfus - All exhibits are to scanned confidential and sealed in the file.

From Jury Trial Held on 04/19/2016.

Stipulation and Order for Return of Exhibits signed and filed.  Exhibits shall be disposed of pursuant to the signed Stipulation and Order and based on the retention period for exhibits in SCR 72.01(46).  
Biological material collected in connection with the action shall be disposed of pursuant to the retention period for exhibits in section 757.54, Wis. Stats.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges Form.
One random voir dire list and one alphabetical voir dire list.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Nicholas J Schmeling in court with attorney Eduardo Maximo Borda.  

Court addressed Motions in Limine with the parties.
Both sides presented arguments.
Courts rulings placed on the record.

JAR called @ 9:27 am. to send up potential jurors.
28 potential jurors sent up @  9:35 am.
Court greeted all potential jurors.
All 28 potential jurors sworn in @ 9:45 am.
Clerk calls the first 18 potential jurors to the jury box.

Court conducts voir dire.
State conducts voir dire.
Defense conducts voir dire.

Parties conduct their strikes.
Clerk reads the 12 selected jurors.
12 Selected jurors sworn in .
Unused jurors sent back down to the JAR @ 10:56 am.

Jurors excused for a brief recess @ 10:58 am.

State moves to Dismiss without prejudice count 2.
Defense has no objections.
Court Grants - Count 2 is dismissed without prejudice.

Court in a brief recess @ 11:03 am.
Court back on the record @  11:18 am.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 11:18 am.

State presented their opening statement.
Defense presented their opening statement.

Witness Called:  M.R. (Victim)
Witness sworn and testified.

Jurors Excused for Lunch @ 12:31 pm.
Both State and Defense received a copy of the jury instructions and verdicts for review.
Court in adjournment for lunch @ 12:34 pm.

Court back on the record @ 1:45 pm.
State addressed some juror contact.
Defense and Court are satisfied the contact was strictly for purposes of directions and not inappropriate.

Witness Called:  M.R. (Victim) - Continued testimony following lunch - Redirect.
Witness acknowledged she was still under oath.

Witness Called: Officer John Resch (City of Oconomowoc Police Department).
Witness sworn and testified.

State rests pending rebuttal.
Jurors excused for a brief adjournment @ 2:33 pm.

Defense moves for a directed verdict for dismissal.
State presented arguments.
Court denies - Defense request for a directed verdict for dismissal.
Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the State has made a prima facia showing.

Court addressed with the defendant his right to testify or not testify.
Defendant chooses to testify.
Parties have stipulated to 5 prior criminal convictions.
Court would agree that 5 is the correct number of prior convictions.

Court in a brief adjournment @ 2:50 pm.
Court back on the record @ 3:04 pm.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 03:04 pm.

Witnesses Called:  Debora Goodman (Defendant's Mother) and Nicholas Schmeling (Defendant).
Witnesses sworn and testified.

Exhibits Marked:  1 - 4.
Exhibits Offered and Received:  1 - 4.
Per Judge Dreyfus - All exhibits are to scanned confidential and sealed in the file.

Defense rests.
Court deems testimony closed.
Jurors excused from the courtroom @ 3:39 pm.

Court addressed jury instructions and verdicts with the parties.

Court in brief recess @ 3:46 pm
Court back on the record @ 4:08 pm.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 4:09 pm.

State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.
State presented rebuttal.

Court read the jurors the jury instructions and verdicts.
Bailiff sworn in @ 5:04 pm.
Jurors excused for deliberations @ 5:05 pm.
Court addressed what exhibits can go back to the jurors if requested.

Court in adjournment @ 5:25 pm.
Jurors notified the Bailiff of a verdict @ 5:36 pm.

Court back on the record @ 5:44 pm.
Jurors returned to the courtroom @ 5:47 pm.

Court read the verdict:  GUILTY of the charge.
Court receives the verdict and enters judgment on the verdict.

Matter put over for sentencing.













  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas J Schmeling in court with attorney Eduardo Maximo Borda.  

Matter will proceed to Trial Tomorrow.

State takes no postition.

  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing at 01-21-2016 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 01-26-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas J Schmeling in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Eduardo M. Borda in court.   
Defendant Nicholas J Schmeling did not appear.   
Attorney appeared by Authorization.
Defense still waiting on some photos of damage to the property.
  Hearing scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Copy of letter to the State from Attorney Borda requesting digitial photographs that were not provided in the discovery material.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant Nicholas J Schmeling in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda. Defendant Nicholas J Schmeling in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.
